item.category: Other damage to pavement i.e. cobbles, raised mound/surface

item.title: Damaged utilities cabinet remains unfixed after 14 months and previous reports, 16th July
item.description:
Damaged utilities cabinet near the entrance to Barlow Road next to Arle House. Hit by a vehicle in May 2024 leaving it leaning and unstable. Red plastic barriers placed round it then left. For picture use Google street view. Reported previously and acknowledged but problem ignored repeatedly. This is now attempt number 4
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Village Road, Kingsditch, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Other damage to pavement i.e. cobbles, raised mound/surface

item.title: Barrier left on pavement in oldbury orchard in churchdown, 16th July
item.description:
Left against the Eastern side hedge near the junction of Oldbury Orchard and Brookfield Road in Churchdown-- GL3 2PD Been there a few weeks

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Brookfield Road, Churchdown, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Signs & Barriers left behind by Contractor

item.title: Long, Foot-wide pothole on Langton Pl, in middle of stretch of road., 16th July
item.description:
Langton Place, the short stretch of road opposite Spirax Sarco that forms the triangle with Cirencester Rd and Cudnall Street. Middle of the stretch is a very long pothole about a foot in width, which your car hits every time you drive down the road.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Langton Place, Ewens Farm, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Post or sign leaning slightly (less than 20 degrees) problem, 16th July
item.description:
Flyposter on street lamp
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Post or sign leaning slightly (less than 20 degrees)

item.title: Faulty traffic lights, 16th July
item.description:
Travelling North on Evesham Road I crossed the green traffic light and turned left into Wellington Square. As I turned the corner I noticed that the green bicycle was illuminated. Had there been a cyclist there accepting the green light whose fault would the crash have been? These are shiny new traffic lights.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Wellington Road, Marle Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Green or amber traffic light is not working

item.title: Most of the drains on Montpelier Street are blocked such as the ones located outside the financial planners, it’s both side of road full of soil, 16th July
item.description:
Most of the drains on Montpelier Street are blocked such as the ones located outside the financial planners, it’s both side of road full. Rain is due this weekend and it won’t have anywhere to go. There are worse ones than the one pictured.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Montpellier Street, Montpellier, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
